short.am,ar,bg,bn,ca,cs,da,de,el,en,en_AU,en_G: Hreflang Checker helps you identify hreflang tags automatically and determine the target language or region of a website.

long.am,ar,bg,bn,ca,cs,da,de,el,en,en_AU,en_G:
The Hreflang Checker tool can help you identify hreflang tags automatically. Hreflang is an HTML attribute that serves to determine the target language and region of a website. This attribute is important for those of you who have multiple versions of your page in different languages ​​and regions.

It also serves to provide a signal to search engines about the version of a page. Having the right hreflang tags can help search engines like Google deliver the right version of a page to the right user. Download and try now!

Features & Benefits

Here are some of the tool’s benefits you should know about:

- This tool is available for free.
- Easy to understand UI: It is designed to make it easier for users to operate it.
- Fast checking process: Users don't need a long time to check hreflang tags.
- Comprehensive results: The tool can display the hreflang tag, the language used, and the target region of the URL being checked.
- History: The history of using this tool will be recorded in the Local History feature making it easier for you to check it again

How to Use

1. Open the Hreflang Checker Tool
As you open this tool, you will see several available features such as the URL column, display results, checking history, and more.

2. Enter Website URL
The second step to identify the hreflang tag is to enter the URL in the field provided. Make sure you have entered the URL in the correct format (e.g. https://example.com). Next, click the "Check URL" button to give the command to this tool to start checking the website.

3. See Hreflang Tag Identification Results
After you press the Check URL button, this tool system will immediately display the identification results quickly. The Result field can display some information such as:

- URL: The URL list shown is a variation of the URL entered earlier. 
- Hreflang Tags: On the right side of the URL list, you can see the hreflang tags used for each URL. It is this HTML tag attribute that tells search engines the relationship between the various language pages on your website. Examples of hreflang tags are "en-id", "en-my", and so on.
- Language: The language used will of course be different for each hreflang tag that is installed. That way, the target user can understand the content of the website according to the chosen language preference.
- Region: The last data you can see in the hreflang checker cmlabs is the target region of the URL being checked. You can find out if the target region of a particular URL matches the language and hreflang tags installed.

4. View Checking History
The last feature of this tool is your Local History. This tool allows you to view all hreflang check history on hreflang checker cmlabs.

With this feature, you don't need to re-type the URL that was checked if you want to re-check it. You can also delete usage history using the "Clear" button on the right side of the usage history feature.

Help & Support
